Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimization of a linear objective function subject to linear equality and inequality constraints.
Solvability: Polynomial-time solvable using simplex or interior point methods.

Name: Integer Programming
Description: Optimization where some or all decision variables must be integers.
Solvability: Generally NP-hard; solvable via branch-and-bound, cutting planes, or heuristics.

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: Linear programming with some decision variables restricted to integers.
Solvability: NP-hard; solved with advanced branch-and-bound and branch-and-cut methods.

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: Optimization with a quadratic objective function and linear constraints.
Solvability: Convex QP solvable in polynomial time; non-convex QP is NP-hard.

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimization where the objective function or constraints are nonlinear.
Solvability: Solvability depends on convexity; general NLP is hard.

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Optimization where the objective and feasible region are convex.
Solvability: Polynomial-time solvable using interior point methods.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Breaks problems into overlapping subproblems and solves them recursively.
Solvability: Polynomial or exponential depending on state space size.
Example: Shortest path in a weighted graph.

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization under uncertainty where data is represented via probability distributions.
Solvability: Complex; often approximated via sampling or scenario methods.
Example: Energy grid planning with uncertain demand.

Name: Combinatorial Optimization
Description: Optimization over a discrete but large set of feasible solutions.
Solvability: Generally NP-hard; solved with heuristics or approximation algorithms.

Name: Multi-Objective Optimization
Solvability: Solutions form a Pareto frontier; exact methods are hard.
Example: Balancing cost and performance in design.
